title: Laura Codruța Kövesi set to become EU’s top prosecutor
text:
Laura Codruța Kövesi's ascension is a blow for Romania’s governing party | Robert Ghement/EPA Laura Codruța Kövesi set to become EU’s top prosecutor Kövesi built a name for herself in her homeland of Romania.

Romania’s Laura Codruța Kövesi is set to become the first-ever chief EU public prosecutor following a deal this evening between the European Parliament and the Council of the EU.

Kövesi will lead the European Public Prosecutor’s Office, a new body that will prosecute crimes involving EU funds such as VAT fraud and money laundering.

The agreement came after EU ambassadors last week voted to shift their endorsement from French candidate Jean-François Bohnert to back Kövesi, the Parliament’s preferred choice.

“Ms Kövesi is the perfect choice,” Spanish MEP Juan Fernando López Aguilar, the chairman of the European Parliament’s Civil Liberties Committee, said in a statement following the deal. “She has excellent professional competences. Moreover, Romania does not currently hold any key posts in the EU. She will be one of the strong women leading in the EU from now on,” he added.

It’s a blow for Romania’s governing party, which last year had Kövesi sacked as the country’s chief anticorruption prosecutor and has heavily opposed her appointment.

Kövesi’s nomination is still subject to final rubberstamping from the Council and Parliament, which is expected to be a formality.
description: Kövesi built a name for herself in her homeland of Romania.
